meanings.definition: To incorrectly name or describe something.
meanings.sent1: She kept misterming the characters in the book.
meanings.sent2: Please do not misterm the scientific process.
meanings.sent3: The cat mistermed the dog as a giant mouse.
meanings.sent4: His misterming of the situation turned the meeting into chaos.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's constant misterming made the students confused.

meanings.definition: To use the wrong term or word to refer to something.
meanings.sent1: He was misterming the ingredients in the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The child mistermed the giraffe as a horse.
meanings.sent3: The comedian mistermed the punchline, causing laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her misterming of the directions led us to the wrong place.
meanings.sent5: The politician's constant misterming of facts misled the public.
